scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Papers series (dated 1929-1993, undated) comprises certificates, newspaper clippings, programs, and publications related to the life and family of Dorothy Woods Morrow. Certificates include Morrow's diplomas from Harlan County Schools in Eastern Kentucky and the Tuskegee College of Nursing in Alabama during the 1940's. The series includes book publications about the history of Black leaders in Kentucky and Black miners and their families in Lynch, Kentucky. The series also contains constitution and ritual books for the Improved Benevolent Protective Order of Elks of the World, an African-American fraternal order, and a Bible given to Morrow's father, John Woods, from his Masonic Lodge.
